extracted_data_phrases: such as a friend , family member , or acquaintance ,
scandal.question: Did you try to lead someone, such as a friend, family member, or acquaintance, into a sinful act?
scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

scandal.question: Did you try to influence someone else's decision, especially if it involved something potentially sinful?
scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

impenitence.question: Have you refused to let go of a particular sin, holding onto it even when confronted with your wrongdoing?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

impenitence.question: Have I stubbornly refused to acknowledge my wrongdoing, clinging to it in my mind?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

impenitence.question: Have you refused to acknowledge your wrongdoing, refusing to give up a particular sin?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

blasphemy.question: Did you swear God's name in anger, frustration, or thoughtlessness?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of sin
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of sin, thereby profaning the sacrament?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: in conformity with the Church 's teachings
blasphemy.question: Did you deliberately receive Holy Communion while aware that your relationship status was not in conformity with the Church's teachings?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: from your faith , Catholic values , or Church teachings
with social pressure or discomfort among friends , family , or community
blasphemy.question: Did you publicly distance yourself from your faith, Catholic values, or Church teachings when faced with social pressure or discomfort among friends, family, or community?
blasphemy.description: This is a public betrayal of Jesus' teaching that "whoever denies me before men, I will also deny before my Father who is in heaven," effectively choosing human respect over fidelity to God.

extracted_data_phrases: of God , Jesus , or any sacred title as an exclamation or in a careless manner
as an exclamation or in a careless manner
blasphemy.question: Did I use the name of God, Jesus, or any sacred title as an exclamation or in a careless manner?
blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.

extracted_data_phrases: on defending my public image , reputation , and social standing than pleasing God
vainglory.question: Am I more focused on defending my public image, reputation, and social standing than pleasing God?
vainglory.description: Vainglory corrupts our good actions by doing them for human acclaim rather than for God's glory, making us slaves to others' opinions rather than true servants of God.

extracted_data_phrases: on seeking human approval and recognition for my achievements
vainglory.question: Am I more focused on seeking human approval and recognition for my achievements than on pleasing God?
vainglory.description: Vainglory corrupts our good actions by doing them for human acclaim rather than for God's glory, making us slaves to others' opinions rather than true servants of God.

extracted_data_phrases: with how my accomplishments and successes are perceived by others rather than pleasing God
vainglory.question: Am I more concerned with how my accomplishments and successes are perceived by others rather than pleasing God?
vainglory.description: Vainglory corrupts our good actions by doing them for human acclaim rather than for God's glory, making us slaves to others' opinions rather than true servants of God.

extracted_data_phrases: in decisions that impact those around me
ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power and dominance cloud my judgment in decisions that impact those around me?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: of success in career advancement and personal growth
in career advancement and personal growth
ambition.question: Did my pursuit of success in career advancement and personal growth let my desire for power and dominance influence my decisions and treatment of others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: to the point that it distracts me from my relationship with God and others
from my relationship with God and others
greed.question: Have I made accumulation of material possessions a driving force in my life, to the point that it distracts me from my relationship with God and others?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: in ways that mistreated , harassed , or discriminated against others
oppression.question: Did I use my authority, power, or influence in ways that mistreated, harassed, or discriminated against others?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: primarily in terms of their usefulness , appearance , or what they could do for me ,
of their usefulness , appearance , or what they could do for me ,
rather than respecting their inherent dignity and worth as children of God
lust.question: Did I view others primarily in terms of their usefulness, appearance, or what they could do for me, rather than respecting their inherent dignity and worth as children of God?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

extracted_data_phrases: primarily as instruments for your own entertainment , enjoyment , or personal gain rather than as fellow human beings deserving of dignity and respect
for your own entertainment , enjoyment , or personal gain rather than as fellow human beings deserving of dignity and respect
as fellow human beings deserving of dignity and respect
lust.question: Did you see others primarily as instruments for your own entertainment, enjoyment, or personal gain rather than as fellow human beings deserving of dignity and respect?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

extracted_data_phrases: especially through words or gestures that expressed lustful desires
lust.question: Have I committed acts outside of marriage that simulated conjugal rights, especially through words or gestures that expressed lustful desires?
lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

extracted_data_phrases: either in reality or through fantasy , outside of the marital bond
lust.question: Have I engaged in sensual acts, either in reality or through fantasy, outside of the marital bond?
lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

extracted_data_phrases: towards someone else 's spouse in my thoughts , which could lead me to objectify them rather than respecting their dignity and commitment
in my thoughts , which could lead me to objectify them rather than respecting their dignity and commitment
rather than respecting their dignity and commitment
lust.question: Have I entertained feelings towards someone else's spouse in my thoughts, which could lead me to objectify them rather than respecting their dignity and commitment?
lust.description: This sin undermines the sacred bond of marriage by treating another person as an object of desire rather than respecting their dignity and commitment to their spouse.

envy.question: Have I secretly wished for others' blessings to be taken away, so that mine might seem more impressive by comparison?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: with what I have and fixate on coveting others ' possessions ,
especially during times of uncertainty or stress
envy.question: Have I been discontent with what I have and fixate on coveting others' possessions, especially during times of uncertainty or stress?
envy.description: This sin stems from ingratitude for one's own blessings and letting material desires control our hearts.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control in conversations, speaking with others using language that was vulgar or inappropriate?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in speaking to others with language that was impolite or unbecoming of your dignity
with language that was impolite or unbecoming of your dignity
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control in speaking to others with language that was impolite or unbecoming of your dignity, thereby offending their feelings?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, thereby neglecting my commitment to temperance?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, particularly when spending time with family and friends?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.question: Have I excessive and wasteful gambling to take precedence over my financial obligations, potentially harming my family's needs or our future?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: over providing for my family 's needs
prodigality.question: Have I prioritized excessive and wasteful spending on entertainment over providing for my family's needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: especially during times of uncertainty or financial strain
prodigality.question: Have I allowed reckless financial decisions to take precedence over my responsibilities to provide for myself and others in need, especially during times of uncertainty or financial strain?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in sharing others ' private affairs through casual conversations
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs through casual conversations, even if they were true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in sharing rumors or confidential information about others
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing rumors or confidential information about others, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: on a Sunday , which otherwise could have been avoided
impiety.question: Did I engage in work on a Sunday, which otherwise could have been avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: with the reverence due to it
impiety.question: Did you fail to always treat the Most Blessed Sacrament with the reverence due to it?
impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

impiety.question: Did I fail to show proper reverence for the Most Blessed Sacrament when attending Holy Mass, participating in Adoration, or making a spiritual Communion?
impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

extracted_data_phrases: for the Most Blessed Sacrament in moments of quiet contemplation or during Eucharistic celebrations
in moments of quiet contemplation or during Eucharistic celebrations

impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

extracted_data_phrases: rather than seeking reconciliation and peace
anger.question: Have I nursed anger in my heart, letting it simmer for too long rather than seeking reconciliation and peace?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.

impurity.question: Have you used practices, substances, or objects to prevent pregnancy in your marriage?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.

extracted_data_phrases: in a manner that offends my dignity and is conducive to immodesty
impurity.question: Have I attired myself in a manner that offends my dignity and is conducive to immodesty?
impurity.description: Wearing attire that's exceptionally revealing or indecent violates chastity and beckons sins from others.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that reveals too much of myself , potentially leading to lustful thoughts or desires from others
to lustful thoughts or desires from others
impurity.question: Have I dressed in a way that reveals too much of myself, potentially leading to lustful thoughts or desires from others?
impurity.description: Wearing attire that's exceptionally revealing or indecent violates chastity and beckons sins from others.

extracted_data_phrases: by engaging in any behavior that would compromise the trust of my spouse or our relationship
in any behavior that would compromise the trust of my spouse or our relationship
of my spouse or our relationship
infidelity.question: Did I break my marriage vows by engaging in any behavior that would compromise the trust of my spouse or our relationship?
infidelity.description: Fidelity in marriage is viewed as a sacred covenant made before God - not just a contract between people, thus breaking vows is seen as a betrayal of both divine and human trust.

fornication.question: Did I have non-procreative sex outside of a valid marriage?
fornication.description: While the sexual natures are a gift, it's a sin to stray away from their ordering toward the unitive and procreative nature within marriage.

extracted_data_phrases: in ways that brought pain or suffering to another person , such as speaking harshly or being intentionally thoughtless
such as speaking harshly or being intentionally thoughtless
violence.question: Have I acted in ways that brought pain or suffering to another person, such as speaking harshly or being intentionally thoughtless?
violence.description: When we deliberately harm others, we attack their God-given dignity.

violence.question: Have I intentionally done something that would have caused pain, distress, or harm to someone else?
violence.description: When we deliberately harm others, we attack their God-given dignity.

extracted_data_phrases: toward someone else 's spouse that compromise their commitment to them
adultery.question: Have I entertained feelings toward someone else's spouse that compromise their commitment to them?
adultery.description: This sin undermines the sacred bond of marriage by treating another person as an object of desire rather than respecting their dignity and commitment to their spouse.

extracted_data_phrases: from tarot card readers , mediums , fortune tellers , or Ouija boards
sorcery.question: Did I seek guidance from tarot card readers, mediums, fortune tellers, or Ouija boards?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

extracted_data_phrases: from mediums , fortune tellers , tarot card readers , or Ouija boards
sorcery.question: Have I ever knowingly sought guidance or answers from mediums, fortune tellers, tarot card readers, or Ouija boards?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

extracted_data_phrases: into conversation with those who claim to receive supernatural knowledge through forbidden means , such as mediums , fortune tellers , tarot card readers , or Ouija boards

through forbidden means , such as mediums , fortune tellers , tarot card readers , or Ouija boards

sorcery.question: Have I entered into conversation with those who claim to receive supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, such as mediums, fortune tellers, tarot card readers, or Ouija boards?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

extracted_data_phrases: without making any effort to change your habits or routines
presumption.question: Did you deliberately persist in sinful behavior, counting on God's mercy without making any effort to change your habits or routines?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: without making any effort to change
presumption.question: Did you deliberately rely on God's mercy without making any effort to change, counting on His forgiveness even when you persisted in sinful behavior?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: without making genuine efforts to change your ways
presumption.question: Did you habitually assume God's mercy without making genuine efforts to change your ways, counting on it to excuse your lack of progress?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

presumption.question: Did you put off going to confession, neglecting to seek forgiveness for your sins until later when circumstances seemed more convenient?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.

extracted_data_phrases: through casual conversations or internal musings
resistance of truth.question: Did you entertain doubts about God's existence through casual conversations or internal musings, especially when faced with life's uncertainties?
resistance of truth.description: Deliberately entertaining doubts about God's existence is a sin against faith because it questions the most fundamental truth of our faith and shows a lack of trust in God's clear self-revelation through creation, scripture, and the Church's teachings.

extracted_data_phrases: either internally through thought or publicly expressed to others
apostasy.question: Have you explicitly rejected the existence of God, either internally through thought or publicly expressed to others?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

extracted_data_phrases: through thoughts , words , or actions that contradict your faith
apostasy.question: Have you explicitly rejected God's existence through thoughts, words, or actions that contradict your faith?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

extracted_data_phrases: either through internal thoughts or discussions with others ,
apostasy.question: Have you explicitly rejected God's existence either through internal thoughts or discussions with others, especially after having been baptized?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.
